business.headline: Here's a step-by-step guide to checking and updating KYC for mutual fundsBefore investing in mutual funds, keeping your KYC up to date is essential. Here's a simple step-by-step guide to checking and updating your KYC details.

Government in talks with insurers for climate-linked insurance scheme: ReportIndia ranks among the most climate-exposed nations, and to address this, the government has started talks with insurers to build a nationwide climate-linked insurance plan.

Sensex, Nifty continue positive run as banking stocks fuel rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 582.95 points to settle at 81,790.12, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 183.40 points to finish above the 25,000 mark.

Diwali 2025: Here's why not every gift you receive is tax-free, says expertWhile exchanging gifts is the highlight of Diwali, some presents may surprise you at tax time. Here's what an expert says about taxable gifts this festive season.
US pharma major Eli Lilly to invest $1 billion in HyderabadThe company will work with local contract manufacturers and set up a new Manufacturing and Quality hub in Hyderabad to oversee production.

Tata Capital IPO: Check latest subscription status, GMP and moreAnalysts have mixed views on the offering. While Tata Capital's strong financials and growth prospects make it appealing for long-term investors, some caution that provisioning for non-performing assets and changes in the company's loan mix may pose risks.

Renault may cut 3,000 jobs worldwide amid global market pressures: ReportFacing slower growth in Europe and increasing competition from rivals, Renault is reportedly planning cuts to its workforce, which could affect around 3,000 employees worldwide.

Sensex jumps over 500 points: Why is the stock market rising today?After a flat opening, the rally on Dalal Street gained momentum as banking, IT, and healthcare stocks led the charge, supported by robust corporate results and steady economic growth.

Canara Robeco IPO opens on October 9: Check price band, other key detailsThe Canara Robeco IPO is entirely an Offer for Sale, with 4.98 crore shares being sold at a price band of Rs 253 to Rs 266 per share.

Why cyber insurance has become a must-have for individuals in IndiaFrom UPI payments to social media, our lives are increasingly online. With cybercrime on the rise, personal cyber insurance is no longer optional—it's a must-have shield.

Bitcoin hits all-time high. Can the rally last?Bitcoin has surged to a new all-time high, crossing $125,000, sparking excitement among investors worldwide. With institutional demand and strong ETF inflows driving the rally, the question remains, can this momentum continue?

GST 2.0 cuts aren't reaching most Indian consumers, finds surveyMost Indian consumers are not seeing the benefits of GST 2.0. Despite tax cuts on essentials and aspirational goods, delayed price updates and supply chain gaps keep savings from reaching buyers.

Gold prices at record high. Should you buy now or wait?Gold has hit a fresh record high, leaving buyers unsure whether to make a move now or wait for a price dip. With festive demand and global uncertainty pushing rates up sharply, the big question is — is this the right time to buy?

Tata Capital IPO opens: Check GMP, key details, and should you apply or skip?The price band has been set at Rs 310 to Rs 326 per share, with a lot size of 46 shares. This means retail investors need a minimum of Rs 14,260 to participate.

Hospital stocks rise after CGHS rate revision. Should you buy?Hospital stocks are in focus today after the government announced the biggest revision in Central Government Health Scheme package rates in 15 years. The new rates, covering nearly 2,000 medical procedures, will come into effect from October 13, 2025.
Sensex, Nifty see muted start; Tata Capital IPO in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 44.18 points to 81,251.35 around 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 18.45 points higher at 24,923.

SIP vs RD: Where should your monthly savings go?Would you rather sleep peacefully or grow wealthy quietly? That's essentially what the SIP vs RD debate boils down to. Both allow disciplined monthly investing, but one protects capital while the other builds it. So which one deserves your money?

Man flags extra charge on cash-on-delivery payments, Centre launches probeThe Department of Consumer Affairs has launched an investigation into e-commerce sites charging additional fees on cash-on-delivery payments.

Agents' body questions GST cut, says move undermines insurance distributionPrashant Mhatre, All India President of the General Insurance Agents Federation Integrated (GIAFI), has sounded an alarm, saying the decision risks weakening the role of agents, brokers, and advisors who are central to India's insurance reach.
Planning a personal loan? Don't make these 5 errorsWhile personal loans can be a handy financial tool, they come with risks if mismanaged. Avoid these five common errors to keep your finances safe.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 episode 44: Malti's game plan under scanner, Tanya-Farrhana clash Cricketer Deepak Chahar's sister Malti, who is the second wild card contestant of 'Bigg Boss 19', remained a topic of discussion in the latest episode. The show also saw a heated argument between Tanya Mittal and Farrhana Bhatt.

Samantha Ruth Prabhu returns to Tollywood with Maa Inti Bangaram. See details Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu confirmed her return to Tollywood on Monday. She shared an update on her upcoming film 'Maa Inti Bangaram' during an Instagram Q&A session with fans. Here's when the shoot begins.

Head hurts but nothing biryani won't fix: Vijay Deverakonda after car accident Actor Vijay Deverakonda reassured fans after escaping unhurt after a car accident near Telangana's Jogulamba Gadwala district. Police confirmed no injuries occurred during the incident.

Taylor Swift on retirement rumours: Shockingly offensive thing to say Taylor Swift has reacted to online rumours suggesting she will retire after marriage with Travis Kelce, and that her new album, 'The Life of a Showgirl', is her final release

Bharti Singh, Haarsh Limbachiyaa expecting second child; celebs shower love Comedian Bharti Singh and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa are set to welcome their second child. The couple announced their pregnancy with an adorable post on Instagram.

Vijay Deverakonda's car meets with accident in Telangana, actor shares update On Monday, actor Vijay Deverakonda survived a car accident while reportedly on his way to Puttaparthi. A video of his damaged car has surfaced on X. He later assured his fans that the car took a hit but he is fine.

Boat capsizes during Tamil film Mandaadi shoot, gear worth Rs 1 crore lost A boat capsized during the filming of the upcoming Tamil movie 'Mandaadi'. Starring actor Soori, the film's shooting has been halted as an investigation undergoes.

Ranbir Kapoor assists wheelchair user at Delhi airport, fans laud actor A lady has thanked actor Ranbir Kapoor for his help at Delhi airport while she was in a wheelchair. Her positive experience with the 'Rockstar' actor is going viral on social media. Fans are appreciating Ranbir for his kind gesture.

Ridley Scott calls modern films mostly mediocre; teases Gladiator III in works Director Ridley Scott has openly criticised the current state of the Hollywood industry, calling most movies mediocre. He also revealed plans for a third 'Gladiator' film and his upcoming sci-fi project.

Anshula Kapoor's note to brother Arjun is moving ode to sibling love and strength Anshula Kapoor posted an emotional note to Arjun Kapoor following her engagement. She describes Arjun as her anchor and constant source of support. The siblings' connection has deepened since the loss of their mother.

Am not opposite Kapil Sharma, excited about my role: Riddhima Kapoor on debut film Riddhima Kapoor is all set to make her Bollywood debut with 'Dadi Ki Shaadi'. Her role brings fresh charm while upholding her family's cinematic legacy.

Salman Khan visits Arbaaz-Sshura's little one at hospital. See pics Superstar Salman Khan was clicked outside Mumbai's Hinduja hospital, where he reportedly visited the newborn baby of his brother Arbaaz Khan and sister-in-law Sshura. He was accompanied by his mother, and sisters Alvira Khan and Arpita Khan.

Akshay Oberoi: Wish I was a Dharma blue-eyed boy | Exclusive Actor Akshay Oberoi shared his experience of working on 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari', which was backed by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions. He also shared his wish of being a Dharma blue-eyed boy.

Kantara Chapter 1: The many layers beyond the divinity of Panjurli and Guliga While the mystical elements involving the guardian deities Panjurli and Guliga may be the biggest attention grabbers for cine-goers across the country, 'Kantara Chapter 1' has so much more to offer.

Bobby Deol celebrates 30 years in cinema, says the fire still burns Bobby Deol has proudly completed thirty years in the film industry, celebrating his journey from his debut in 'Barsaat' to his recent role in Netflix's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. He shared a post on Monday, marking the feat.

OTT this week: Kurukshetra, Swim to Me and more - What to watch, where and when This week, fans will be in for some interesting films and shows releasing on streaming platforms. A glimpse at this week's binge-watching guide, from animation to documentaries to dramas.

Sunjay Kapur's sister blames Priya Sachdev for his split with Karisma Kapoor Mandhira Kapur Smith claims Priya Sachdev interfered in Sunjay Kapur and Karisma Kapoor's marriage. Allegations arise during an ongoing Rs 30,000 crore inheritance dispute. Priya had previously shared details of her relationship with Sunjay Kapur.

Malti Chahar confronts Tanya Mittal on BB19, asks about sarees, baklava Malti Chahar's bold and straightforward entry as a wild card contestant in Bigg Boss 19 has stirred up the house with sharp exchanges, especially with Tanya Mittal. Her composed yet candid approach is creating a fresh buzz among viewers and housemates alike.

Internet slams fan's Daiva costume at Kantara show: Not divine, mockery A fan dressed as Daiva during 'Kantara: Chapter 1' screening in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul went viral. Internet users criticised the act as disrespectful to Tulunadu tradition.

general news.headline: PM speaks to Chief Justice Gavai, says attack on him has angered all IndiansUnfazed by the attack, Chief Justice Gavai carried on with the proceedings nonchalantly. It was CJI Gavai's calm demeanour that caught PM's attention, and he praised him for maintaining composure in the face of the incident.

Rajdeep Sardesai lists 5 X-factors that could decide winner in Bihar pollsIndia Today's Consulting Editor, Rajdeep Sardesai, breaks down the five key "X-factors" in Bihar that could determine whether the ruling NDA holds on to power or the opposition alliance springs a surprise.

Supreme Court lawyer suspended for trying to throw shoe at Chief Justice GavaiThe suspension bars the Supreme Court advocate from appearing, acting, pleading or practising in any court, tribunal or authority across the country.

Vijay Deverakonda's car meets with accident in Telangana, actor shares updateOn Monday, actor Vijay Deverakonda survived a car accident while reportedly on his way to Puttaparthi. A video of his damaged car has surfaced on X. He later assured his fans that the car took a hit but he is fine.

How Russian engines link Pakistan's JF-17s, India's MiG-29sThere is a buzz that Russia would be supplying engines for Pakistan's Chinese-origin JF-17 Thunder fighter jets. It's the same class of engines used by India's MiG-29 fleet. But why do Chinese jets rely on Russian engines?

Bihar to vote on November 6, 11, results on 14thBihar Assembly polls are to be held in two phases on November 6 and 11, and the results will be on November 14, CEC Gyanesh Kumar declared. The term of the 243-member Bihar Assembly will end on November 22.

Chinese weapons did exceptionally well against India during Op Sindoor, claims PakistanDespite evidence that China's PL-15 missiles were shredded, and Indian systems delivered deadly punch, Pakistan's DGISPR Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry claimed in an interview with Bloomberg that Chinese weapons performed "exceptionally well".

Who is Rakesh Kishore, lawyer who tried attacking CJI with shoe in Supreme Court?The senior advocate is known within the legal fraternity for his long-standing membership in multiple bar associations. Police found Kishore carrying membership cards from the Supreme Court Bar Association, Shahdara Bar Association, and the Bar Council of Delhi.
The bigger games behind Munir's Pasni offerIs Asim Munir laying the foundation of a bigger US-funded CPEC passing through Pakistan's southern flanks and into Central Asia?

Why do Desi apps often fail and what does it say about future of Arattai?Arattai messaging app is all the rage nowadays. It is not the first Indian app that has caught the fancy of social media chatter. And it won't be the last. But like Hike, Koo, and others, this one too will find it difficult to sustain its momentum.

Didn't pick up the Nobel call: Meet the winners of Nobel Prize 2025 in MedicineShimon Sakaguchi, Mary E Brunkow and Fred Ramsdell won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Medicine for uncovering how the body prevents immune attacks on itself. Sakaguchi discovered regulatory T cells, while Brunkow and Ramsdell identified the key gene, Foxp3, that governs their function.

Pak ships first batch of rare earths to US, sparks outrage over secret dealsPakistan has dispatched its first shipment of rare earth minerals to the US under a $500-million deal with an American company. The Imran Khan-led PTI has raised concerns over the secrecy of the agreements, demanding full disclosure. Critics fear such deals undermine Pakistan's sovereignty and national interest.

Kantara Chapter 1: The many layers beyond the divinity of Panjurli and GuligaWhile the mystical elements involving the guardian deities Panjurli and Guliga may be the biggest attention grabbers for cine-goers across the country, 'Kantara Chapter 1' has so much more to offer.

Alisha Chinai explains why she reunited with Anu Malik after sexual harassment caseSinger Alisha Chinai has recalled her 1996 accusation of sexual harassment against Anu Malik and the industry's reaction. She has spoken about her initial isolation in the music industry following her complaint, and revealed why she decided to work with Malik again after he apologised.

Always so f***ing negative: Trump told Netanyahu to 'take the win' on Gaza planBenjamin Netanyahu dismissed Hamas's response to the Gaza peace plan as insignificant. This prompted Donald Trump to snap back and say, "I don't know why you're always so f***ing negative. This is a win. Take it."

Trump imposes 25% tariffs on medium, heavy-duty trucks from November 1Donald Trump had initially announced in September that the levies would start on October 1, but the deadline was postponed after industry executives raised concerns over costs, supply chains, and competitiveness.

Why the Moon looks so big tonight: The supermoon illusion explainedThe celestial event is visible across many countries in the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, North America, the United Kingdom, and parts of the United States.

Why is a doctor responsible? Medical body questions clean chit to cough syrup makerThe Indian Medical Association has objected to the arrest of a doctor linked to the ongoing cough syrup controversy, sources said. They have also questioned the reason behind the clean chit given to the alleged cough syrup-making company.

Stop arranging IND vs PAK fixtures, cricket now propaganda tool: Ex-England captainFormer England captain Michael Atherton has argued against 'arranging' for India vs Pakistan fixtures in International Cricket Council tournaments even if they are a cash cow for the global body. In the wake of the Asia Cup tournament, Atheton has argued that the marquee fixture has turned into a tool for political theatre.

Rahul Dravid's son, Anvay set to lead Karnataka in Vinoo Mankad TrophyLike father, like son — that seems to be the story in the Dravid household, as Anvay Dravid, son of legendary India batter Rahul Dravid, is set to lead Karnataka in the upcoming Vinoo Mankad Trophy.

Yes, Meghan, now we're talking…Meghan Markle arrived at the Balenciaga show at Paris Fashion Week to support designer Pierpaolo Piccioli on Saturday, and through her dramatic ensemble, she made the world take notice of her once again.

Indian-origin teen who died saving friend in knife attack awarded UK bravery medalGrace O'Malley-Kumar was returning to her University of Nottingham with her friend Barnaby Webber when they were accosted by a knife-wielding man in June 2023. They were both killed in the attack.

On camera: BJP MP Khagen Murmu bleeds after locals attack him with stonesBJP MP Khagen Murmu and MLA Shankar Ghosh were attacked by locals in West Bengal's Nagrakata while they were visiting a flood-hit area.

Is Nitish Kumar the Sleepy Joe of Bihar?Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, who has, at least for the last two years, shown signs of fatigue and confusion publicly, is facing the Opposition's attacks over his health. RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav and Jan Suraaj's Prashant Kishor's have called him "clueless and ill". Will Nitish, who has now been branded the "Joe Biden of Bihar" for his gaffes, manage to survive the pre-poll heat and secure a 10th term? Or will he be forced to drop out like Biden?

sports.headline: World Cup is the biggest stage for Bangladesh to show talent: Nigar Sultana Nigar Sultana feels that the Women's World Cup 2025 is the biggest stage for Bangladesh to show their talent and get big teams to play against them in the coming years. Bangladesh won their first match in the tournament.

We'll look to negate in-form Marufa Akter's swing early on: Charlie Dean England's vice-captain admitted that they will be looking to tackle Bangladesh's Marufa Akter's swing early on in their upcoming clash in the Women's World Cup.

Having Nat Sciver-Brunt, Charlotte Edwards feels like a fresh start: Charlie Dean England vice-captain Charlie Dean says having Natalie Sciver-Brunt as captain and Charlotte Edwards as coach has brought a "fresh start" to the team, with renewed focus, clarity, and a shared determination to play fearless, detail-driven cricket.

Shaw to face Mumbai in Maharashtra practice match ahead of Ranji Trophy Prithvi Shaw will play against his former Mumbai teammates after moving to Maharashtra, as both teams prepare for the upcoming Ranji Trophy season with a practice match at MCA Stadium, Gahunje. Shardul Thakur leads a Shreyas Iyer-less Mumbai, with Ruturaj Gaikwad and Jalaj Saxena included in the Maharashtra squad.

Marufa Akter can become Bangladesh's greatest pacer ever: Nigar Sultana Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana feels that Marufa Akter can become the greatest pacer produced by the nation. Marufa was in fine form during the first match of the tournament against Pakistan.

Rahul Dravid's son, Anvay set to lead Karnataka in Vinoo Mankad Trophy Like father, like son — that seems to be the story in the Dravid household, as Anvay Dravid, son of legendary India batter Rahul Dravid, is set to lead Karnataka in the upcoming Vinoo Mankad Trophy.

Can't play half games in World Cups: Devine slams New Zealand's poor show in Indore New Zealand women's skipper, Sophie Devine, was critical of their showcase in the defeat against South Africa, suggesting that they need to put in their all across all facets of the game to ensure they get their first points on the board.

Tazmin Brits' day in Indore: Breaking Lanning's record, celebration picked by fans South Africa Tazmin Brits reacted to breaking Meg Lanning's record and the reason behind her arrow celebration after the win over New Zealand. Brits scored 101 as the Proteas women recorded their first win of the Women's World Cup 2025 on Monday, October 6.

South Africa bounce back with resounding win as New Zealand's woes continue Women's World Cup: South Africa have their first points on the board as they took a rather resounding win over New Zealand, riding on the back of brilliant performances by the centurion, Tazmin Britz and Nonkululeko Mlaba's four-wicket haul.

Where is the 2024 Ballon d'Or winner? Rodri's persistent injuries have kept him off the field, leaving fans and pundits wondering if and when he will return to the form that made him Europe's elite midfielder.

Gautam Gambhir to host Indian team for dinner ahead of Delhi Test vs West Indies India head coach Gautam Gambhir has invited the entire Indian squad and support staff for dinner ahead of the second Test in Delhi. This sets up as a good chance for the team to unwind ahead of a busy schedule.

Can't play half games in World Cups: Devine slams New Zealand's poor show in Indore New Zealand women's skipper, Sophie Devine, was critical of their showcase in the defeat against South Africa, suggesting that they need to put in their all across all facets of the game to ensure they get their first points on the board.

Gautam Gambhir to host Indian team for dinner ahead of Delhi Test vs West Indies India head coach Gautam Gambhir has invited the entire Indian squad and support staff for dinner ahead of the second Test in Delhi. This sets up as a good chance for the team to unwind ahead of a busy schedule.

Catch of the tournament? Laura Wolvaardt produces screamer in SA vs NZ clashLaura Wolvaardt produced the catch of the tournament as she took a one-handed stunner to dismiss Lea Tahuhu during the South Africa vs New Zealand clash in the Women's World Cup 2025.

Abhishek Sharma backed by AB de Villiers to thrive in Australian conditionsAB de Villiers believes that Abhishek Sharma can thrive in the Australian conditions as India prepare for their white-ball tour Down Under later this month.

Rohit Sharma non-committal about World Cup? Expect more bad news then, says GavaskarSunil Gavaskar sent a warning to Rohit Sharma and told him to expect more bad news if he remains non-committal about his participation in the 2027 ODI World Cup. Rohit was removed as the captain of the Indian ODI team on October 4.

No Virat Kohli or Rohit Sharma, but IND vs AUS 2nd T20I at MCG sells out anywayPublic tickets for the second T20I between India and Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground were sold out more than three weeks before the fixture, underlining the enduring appeal of the contest even without superstars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

Yusuf Dikec returns with his aura farming: Turkish shooter wins European goldYusuf Dikec, the popular and viral Turkish shooter, is back in the spotlight with European gold. At 52, his trademark "aura farming" style continues to charm fans and deliver results.

In the wake of the Asia Cup tournament, Atheton has argued that the marquee fixture has turned into a tool for political theatre.

Harmanpreet Kaur under pressure in what could be her final World Cup: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has claimed that Harmanpreet Kaur will be under pressure after enduring a lean patch in the ongoing Women's World Cup 2025. Harmanpreet has failed to make an impact in the first two matches of the World Cup.

Pakistan batter reprimanded for breaching ICC Code of Conduct in IND vs PAK clashIndia defeated Pakistan by 88 runs in the ICC Women's World Cup, while Sidra Amin received a reprimand for equipment abuse during the match. India's win highlights their continuous unbeaten streak.

Watch: Salah gets hero's welcome in Cairo after missing out on Ballon d'OrMohamed Salah got a hero's welcome in Cairo after missing out on winning the Ballon d'Or this year. Salah finished fourth in the rankings behind Ousmane Dembele, Lamine Yamal and Vitinha.

Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli need domestic cricket to play 2027 WC: Irfan PathanRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli aim for the 2027 ODI World Cup, but match fitness remains their biggest challenge. Irfan Pathan urges domestic cricket to maintain game readiness, keeping hopes alive for fans worldwide.

Indian players to feature in sixth edition of Lankan Premier LeagueThe Lanka Premier League's sixth edition, beginning December 1, will feature Indian players for the first time, with 24 matches across three venues.

No crowd for Tests, but 24,000 watch India A vs Australia A ODI in KanpurIndia A vs Australia A has drawn 24,000 people in Kanpur. In sharp contrast, the Test match between India and West Indies saw barely any crowd in Ahmedabad.

India urged to fix batting issues after Pakistan win before tougher World Cup gamesFormer India batter Anjum Chopra has called on India to not overvalue their dominant win over Pakistan in the Women's World Cup, warning that unresolved issues, particularly in the batting department, could cost them against stronger teams like South Africa, New Zealand, and Australia. Chopra and skipper Harmanpreet Kaur both highlighted the importance of addressing inconsistencies before facing tougher opponents.

NZ vs SA Highlights: Brits, Luus help Proteas secure 6-wicket winNew Zealand (NZ) vs South Africa (SA) Women's World Cup Live: Tazmin Brits' hundred and Sune Luus' 83 not out has helped South Africa secure a six-wicket win against New Zealand in Indore. The Proteas have bounced back after their loss to England while New Zealand continue to search for answers.

I don't like attitude, arrogance: Mohammed Siraj on staying grounded after fameMohammed Siraj reflected on his outlook on life after rising to fame as one of India's premier fast bowlers. The Hyderabad pacer said he has stayed grounded and has not forgotten his humble beginnings.

Hikaru throws away Gukesh's king: Was it drama or disrespect?World No.2 Hikaru Nakamura stoked controversy after beating India's D Gukesh in USA's Checkmate tournament. After his win, Hikaru picked up Gukesh's king and threw it into the crowd. Was it disrespectful, or was the drama done to grab eyeballs?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
